bill.title: State use law; purchases by municipalities; committee sunset date and chairperson selection.
bill.description: State use law; purchases by municipalities; committee sunset date and chairperson selection.

history.action: Senate Introduced
Senate Referred to Committee on Judiciary
Senate Hearing: Tuesday, February 12, 2013, 10:30 AM Room 346-S
Senate Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by
Senate Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Holland
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Holland was withdrawn
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Holland
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Holland was rejected
Senate Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Senator Haley
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Haley was rejected
Senate Senator Tyson motioned to reconsider action on Holland's rejected amendment. Motion adopted.  Yea: 25 Nay: 14
Senate  Senator Pyle raised a question of germaneness. The amendment was ruled germane.
Senate Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Senator Holland was adopted  Yea: 23 Nay: 17
Senate Committee of the Whole - Be passed as further amended
Senate Emergency Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 31 Nay: 9
House Received and Introduced
House Referred to Committee on Elections
House Hearing: Monday, March 11, 2013, 1:30 PM Room 281-N
House Committee Report recommending bill be passed as amended by
House Committee of the Whole - Committee Report be adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Huebert
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Huebert was adopted
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Dillmore
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Dillmore was rejected
House Committee of the Whole - Motion to Amend - Offered by  Representative Alcala
House Committee of the Whole - Amendment by  Representative Alcala was rejected
House Committee of the Whole - Be passed as amended
House Emergency Final Action - Passed as amended;  Yea: 69 Nay: 53
Senate Nonconcurred with amendments; Conference Committee requested; appointed Senator King , Senator Smith and Senator Haley as conferees
House Motion to accede adopted;  Representative Schwab,  Representative Huebert and  Representative Sawyer appointed as conferees
House  Representative Kinzer replaces  Representative Schwab on the Conference Committee
House  Representative Bruchman replaces  Representative Huebert on the Conference Committee
House  Representative Pauls replaces  Representative Sawyer on the Conference Committee
House Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
House Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Representative Kinzer,  Representative Bruchman and  Representative Pauls appointed as second conferees
Senate Conference Committee Report agree to disagree adopted;  Senator King,  Senator Smith and  Senator Haley appointed as second conferees
Senate  Senator Tyson replaces  Senator King on the Conference Committee
Senate  Senator Bruce replaces  Senator Smith on the Conference Committee
Senate  Senator Holland replaces  Senator Haley on the Conference Committee
Senate  Senator Lynn replaces  Senator Tyson on the Conference Committee
Senate  Senator Wagle replaces  Senator Bruce on the Conference Committee
House  Representative Kleeb replaces  Representative Kinzer on the Conference Committee
House  Representative Suellentrop replaces  Representative Bruchman on the Conference Committee
House  Representative Frownfelter replaces  Representative Pauls on the Conference Committee
House Conference committee report now available
House Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
House Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 124 Nay: 0
Senate Conference committee report now available
Senate Motion to suspend Joint Rule 4 (k) to allow consideration adopted;
Senate Conference Committee Report was adopted;  Yea: 40 Nay: 0
Senate Enrolled and presented to Governor on Monday, May 12, 2014
Senate Approved by Governor on Wednesday, 14 May 2014

Senate Emergency Final Action - Passed as amended - Yea: 31 Nay: 9
